# How to replace part of a string with another string in JavaScript?

Published June 13, 2020

We can use the `replace` string method to replace a string with another string in JavaScript. --- Consider this string. ```javascript const greeting = "Hi, Friend"; ``` Let's replace the string `Hi` to `Hello`. ```javascript const greeting = "Hi, Friend"; // replacing string Hi to Hello greeting.replace("Hi", "Hello"); // Result: Hello, friend ``` - The method accepts the string to replace as the first argument. - And the string to be replaced with as the second argument. - It returns a string with the replaced string. - The method also accepts [Regular expression](https://www.w3schools.com/jsref/jsref_obj_regexp.asp) as the first argument. - It is a string only method. ### Using regular expression We can also replace all the occurrences of a specific word in a string using a regular expression. ```javascript const favoriteLine = "Blue has 3 Blue bottles"; // all occurences of Blue will be replaced by Green str.replace(/blue/gi, "Green"); // Result: Green has 3 Green bottles ``` ### Feel free to share if you found this useful ðŸ˜ƒ. ---
